column4: Description

"Maxwell's equations poetically describe electricity and magnetism intertwining. With a deeper understanding, machines can be created for acquiring and using electrical energy with high efficiency." - This perk gives you scientific knowledge and blueprtints to create devices unlocked by the technology of the same name from the DSP game.

This perk gives you a mental compendium of scientific knowledge and blueprints to understand, craft, and maintain all devices and structures of Tier Two technology from the DSP game. You can obtain this perk without perks for previous Tiers, but there will be expected holes in your understanding. You can reroll this perk for free.

You have the ability to build the basic Icarus mecha from DSP. You have the blueprint and extensive skills to maintain and use this machine, but you don't have complete knowledge of its inner workings. It has high tinkertech cheating potential to cut corners to create this mecha.

This perk gives you the thinker ability to search for and view resources around you. It cannot highlight every kind of resources - only works best with DSP and related types of materials. This perk can be purchased four times in total, costing 100 CP more for each purchase.

You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier One upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily.

You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Two upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily. You can buy this perk without having previous ones, but there will be expected gaps in your knowledge and abilities. You can reroll this perk for free.

You can reroll this perk for free.

This mental compendium of blueprints and the necessary knowledge allows you to create and implement building upgrades from the DSP game. It works much better with DSP technology. You can reverse engineer upgradable buildings using only this perk in theory, but it would be tedious, awkward, and would take a lot of time and testing. Infinite Tiers become more and more vague, incomplete, until unrecognizable in the compendium of this perk.

This mental compendium of blueprints and the necessary knowledge allows you to create and implement combat upgrades from the DSP game. It works much better with DSP technology. You can reverse engineer upgradable items and structures using only this perk in theory, but it would be tedious, awkward, and would take a lot of time and testing. Infinite Tiers become more and more vague, incomplete, until unrecognizable in the compendium of this perk.
